name: Relativity Space
headline: Building humanityâs multiplanetary future.
description:
Relativity is building humanityâs multiplanetary future. We invented a new approach to design, build, and fly our own rockets, starting with Terran 1 â the worldâs first entirely 3D printed rocket, and Terran R, our next generation medium-heavy lift fully reusable launch vehicle.

As a vertically integrated technology platform, Relativity is at the forefront of an inevitable shift toward software-defined manufacturing. By fusing 3D printing, artificial intelligence, and autonomous robotics, we are pioneering the factory of the future. Disrupting 60 years of aerospace, Relativity offers a radically simplified supply chain, building a rocket with 100x fewer parts in less than 60 days.

We believe in a future where interplanetary life fundamentally expands the possibilities for human experience. Our long-term vision is to upgrade humanityâs industrial base on Earth and on Mars.
tags: industry:machine-learning; industry:space-exploration; industry:rocketry; industry:3d-printing; industry:manufacturing; location:los-angeles

[ ![Relativity Space](http://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/59a8fb50d2b8575fad311abb/1505499304234-STDBEYPYD2DPUUIHRAL4/Relativity_White_RGB_900px.png) ](http://relativityspace.com/</>)
Building the future of humanity in space
Scroll
A Customer-CentricRocket Company
## Launching the future of humanity in space
A rocket company at the core, Relativity Space is on a mission to become the next great commercial launch company. With an ever-growing need for space infrastructure, demand for launch services is continuously outpacing supply. Our reusable rockets can meet this demand, offering customers the right size payload capacity at the right cost. Using an iterative development approach, we are strategically focused on reducing vehicle complexity, cost, and time to market. Our patented technologies enable innovative designs once thought impossible and unlock new value propositions in the booming space economy.
[ ![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/59a8fb50d2b8575fad311abb/7024f025-ee9c-4b17-a4e2-c0722d2a00f0/2023-03-22_Terran-1-GLHF_Kraus_3849.jpg) ](http://relativityspace.com/</first-launch-gallery>)
[ ![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/59a8fb50d2b8575fad311abb/b034f0fb-1317-46ea-a633-7589ed65e6df/2023-03-22_Terran-1-GLHF_Kraus_Res-Full_1076.jpg) ](http://relativityspace.com/</first-launch-gallery>)
[ ![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/59a8fb50d2b8575fad311abb/79e60cdb-d19c-4b21-9685-d7a0ce0fce85/2023-03-22_Terran-1-GLHF_Kraus_6532.jpg) ](http://relativityspace.com/</first-launch-gallery>)
[ Terran 1 Launch Gallery ](http://relativityspace.com/</first-launch-gallery>)
Meet Terran R
## A MEDIUM-TO-HEAVY LIFT REUSABLE ROCKET 
Terran R’s design is an evolution of best-in-class architecture solutions, with strategic design choices to prioritize reusability, efficiency, and cost-savings. Intentionally designed to meet the needs of today's and tomorrow's payloads, Terran R can launch: 
  * 23,500 kg to Low Earth Orbit (LEO), downrange landing
  * 5,500 kg to a Geosynchronous Transfer Orbit (GTO), downrange landing
  * 33,500 kg payload to LEO, expendable configuration 


[ Learn about Terran R ](http://relativityspace.com/</terran-r>)
![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/59a8fb50d2b8575fad311abb/a3e7e6b8-035a-4d6c-9183-28b7c079b6f4/TERRAN_R_TRN.SBS.001.png)
## TERRAN R
# Launching Customer Satellites
Our Terran R launch vehicle will meet market demand, offering a commercially competitive alternative. 
[LEARN MORE](http://relativityspace.com/</terran-r>)
![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/59a8fb50d2b8575fad311abb/33ac08df-9466-49a0-bbce-6f866658d2dc/TERRAN_R_LAUNCH_web.png)
## AEON R
# Propelling Us Into the Future 
Leveraging advances in additive manufacturing, our 3D printed engines enable high performance. 
[LEARN MORE](http://relativityspace.com/</terran-r/#aeon-r>)
![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/59a8fb50d2b8575fad311abb/ba295639-bca6-4cde-94c8-f0b71caff648/Aeon_R_web.jpg)
## INFRASTRUCTURE
# Ramping to Scale 
We're investing in infrastructure build-out to rapidly design, test, and manufacture rockets at an unprecedented pace. 
[LEARN MORE](http://relativityspace.com/</infrastructure>)
![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/59a8fb50d2b8575fad311abb/e21e4489-ce77-418c-9bfa-0bce3fbdc859/Woho_Infra.png)
![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/59a8fb50d2b8575fad311abb/52741afb-76f1-4351-8a7b-e1dabce304bf/Trevor-Mahlmann-Terran-1-Launch-Mar-11-2023-East-Vert-999.JPG)
# Embracing Iterative Learning
In March 2023, we successfully launched Terran 1, the world’s largest 3D printed object, into space. This maiden voyage proved that large-scale 3D printed objects are flight-worthy, even in dynamic environments. 
Building on the success of the Terran 1 program, we’re accelerating our focus towards Terran R, our medium-to-heavy lift reusable rocket. The journey to Terran 1’s launch demonstrated our ability to design, analyze, develop, complete qualification, acceptance, and certification programs, and ultimately fly an orbital class rocket into space. The experience, learnings, proof points, and data gathered during this program are major steps toward the development of Terran R. 
The team continues to iterate on designs – ensuring we bring a reliable and compelling product to market. Leveraging the value of additive manufacturing, our engineers and technicians can transform a component from concept into produced part in a matter of weeks. 
  * Using an ascent launch vehicle complexity and development sophistication lends itself to a larger program like Terran R
  * The primary 3D printed structures and integrated structures are designed for dozens of cycles
  * Its high performance, 3D printed, liquid oxygen/methane propulsion systems will use a gas generator (GG) combustion cycle


[ MORE ABOUT FIRST FLIGHT ](http://relativityspace.com/</glhf>)
# Watch Terran 1’s First Flight to Space
![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/59a8fb50d2b8575fad311abb/1679760099137-MDPW8UJKGHIIMIDA8YB1/2023-03-22_Terran-1-GLHF_Kraus_Res-Full_1076.jpg) [![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/59a8fb50d2b8575fad311abb/af7ed0b2-2f09-428e-8b57-55fecc08eaf9/YT_Icon.png)](http://relativityspace.com/<https:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=2oLEtWeTowo&t=1s>)

generated_description:
**Company Overview: Relativity Space**

Founded in 2016 and emerging from Y Combinator's Batch W16, Relativity Space is on a bold mission: "Building humanity’s multiplanetary future." With its headquarters in Los Angeles, CA, the company is redefining how rockets are designed, manufactured, and launched. 

At the heart of Relativity Space's innovation is its commitment to 3D printing, enabling unprecedented efficiency in rocket production. Take Terran 1, for instance—the world’s first entirely 3D printed rocket, which symbolizes a seismic shift in aerospace engineering. Following this, Terran R, the company’s next-generation medium-heavy lift fully reusable vehicle, promises to scale up operations even further.

**What Makes Relativity Space Different?**

Relativity Space isn’t just a rocket manufacturer; it's a vertically integrated technology platform. By merging 3D printing with artificial intelligence and autonomous robotics, it's creating the "factory of the future." This radical approach boils down to building rockets with 100 times fewer parts and dramatically reducing production times to less than 60 days. This is design and manufacturing at a speed and simplicity that the aerospace industry has never seen before.

**The Vision**

Relativity Space envisions a future where human life extends beyond Earth, fundamentally altering our experiences in the universe. The company's long-term strategy isn't just to launch rockets but to upgrade the industrial base on both Earth and Mars, pushing forward human capabilities.

**The Team and Its Growth**

With a robust team of around 1,000 employees, Relativity is not just about technology; it's about people united under a visionary cause. Their tagline of being a "Customer-Centric Rocket Company" emphasizes their strategic focus on fulfilling the rapidly growing demand for space infrastructure and launch services.

**Current Projects and Future Prospects**

Recent successes include the launch of Terran 1 in March 2023, which validated their 3D printing methodology. Now, they are ramping up efforts on Terran R, designed for significant payload capabilities and increased reusability—key elements that position Relativity Space to meet market demands head-on.

In conclusion, Relativity Space is more than an aerospace company; it's a dynamic player set to revolutionize space exploration. Through innovative technology and a forward-thinking vision, they're not just aiming to reach new frontiers; they're preparing humanity for a future amongst the stars. If you want to dive deeper, check out their website at [relativityspace.com](http://relativityspace.com).
